pageContext.claim: “We all like Ronald Reagan. I liked him. I thought he was a great guy, but if he came to Pennsylvania for a rally, you know, if he had a thousand people in a ballroom or something.”
pageContext.analysis: This is false. Reagan attracted huge crowds. For instance, in 1984, a Reagan rally attracted 100,000 people to a rally in Doylestown, about two hours away from Hersey, Penna., where Trump spoke to a crowd estimated to be about 10,000 people.
